summary: It says he’s sponsoring a proposal to ban “every pump shotgun” and voted “to ban deer-hunting ammunition.” Don’t believe either claim.

title: Kerry and Bush Mislead Voters With Promises of Energy Independence
summary:
Summary
Both John Kerry and President Bush have promised voters that they will make America “energy independent.” But experts say both sides fall far short of what is necessary for energy independence in the next few decades.
Kerry focuses on conservation efforts, but most agree his plan is little more than an outline. Bush supports expanded drilling in Alaska to increase domestic oil supply, but the US has only about 3 percent of the world’s oil reserves.

title: Media Fund Twists the Truth More Than Michael Moore
summary: Radio ad claims most air traffic was grounded when bin Laden’s family was allowed to leave. Not true. In fact, the FBI questioned 22 of them and found no links to terrorism.

title: Would Kerry Throw Us To The Wolves?
summary: A misleading Bush ad criticizes Kerry for proposing to cut intelligence spending — a decade ago, by 4%, when some Republicans also proposed cuts.

title: An Avalanche of Misinformation
summary: With election day approaching the tempo of ads is increasing, but not the level of factual accuracy. Both sides are making false or misleading claims in their ads.

title: $8 Million Worth Of Distortions
summary: Two Bush ads full of misleading and false statements ran more than 9,000 times in 45 cities last week.

title: How Liberal is John Kerry?
summary: A new RNC ad claims Kerry is “the most liberal man in the Senate.” Actually, his lifetime rating is 11th or lower, depending.

title: Kerry Falsely Claims Bush Plans To Cut Social Security Benefits
summary: A Kerry ad claims “Bush has a plan to cut Social Security benefits by 30 to 45 percent.” That’s false. Bush has proposed no such plan, and the proposal Kerry refers to would only slow down the growth of benefits, and only for future retirees.

title: Just How Many Bills Has Kerry Passed?
summary: Bush said Kerry passed five bills. Kerry said he’s passed 56. Who’s right? That depends on the definition of “passed” and “bills.”

title: New And Recycled Distortions At Final Presidential Debate
summary: Bush claims most of his tax cuts went to low- and middle-income persons. Kerry says Pell Grants were cut. Don’t believe either.

title: Kerry’s Tax Ad: Literally Accurate, But Misleading
summary: His ad says “the middle class is paying a bigger share of America’s tax burden.” True. But it’s a smaller burden all around. And the richest still pay the most.

title: Pro-Bush Puffery on Economy, Medicare
summary: New ad claims Bush inherited an economy “already in recession” and that 41 million seniors “now have access to lower cost prescriptions.” Wrong on both counts.

title: Distortions Galore at Second Presidential Debate
summary: Both candidates played loose with the facts at the second Presidential Debate in St. Louis Oct. 8. We offer a sampler of the dubious and sometimes false statements made by each of the candidates.

title: Cheney & Edwards Mangle Facts
summary: Getting it wrong about combat pay, Halliburton, and FactCheck.org.

title: Bush Mischaracterizes Kerry’s Health Plan
summary: A Bush ad claims Kerry’s healthcare proposals would put “big government in charge” of medical decisions. In fact, Kerry’s plan would leave 97% with the insurance they have now — while up to 27 million who aren’t insured would gain coverage.

title: Distortions and Misstatements At First Presidential Debate
summary: Bush and Kerry both have problems with the facts at their meeting in Coral Gables.

title: Kerry Ad Falsely Accuses Cheney on Halliburton
summary: A Kerry ad implies Cheney has a financial interest in Halliburton and is profiting from the company’s contracts in Iraq. The fact is, Cheney doesn’t gain a penny from Halliburton’s contracts, and almost certainly won’t lose even if Halliburton goes bankrupt.

title: The “Willie Horton” Ad Of 2004?
summary: Republican group’s ad shows Osama, Kerry. It appeals to fear, and twists Kerry’s record on defense, intelligence, Iraq.

title: Bush Ad Twists Kerry’s Words on Iraq
summary: Selective use of Kerry’s own words makes him look inconsistent on Iraq. A closer look gives a different picture.

title: GOP Web site Uses Misleading Kerry Quote On Abortion
summary: When Kerry said abortions should be moved ‘into the mainstream of medical practice,’ he was talking about safer locations, not more frequent abortions.

title: Are Bush and Cheney “Small Businesses?”  Their Ad Counts Them As Such
summary: A Bush-Cheney ’04 ad claims Kerry would raise taxes on 900,000 small businesses and “hurt jobs.” But it counts every high-salaried person who has even $1 of outside business income as a “small business owner” — a definition so broad that even Bush and Cheney have qualified while in office,

title: ACLU Ad On “Sneak-and-Peek” Searches: Overblown
summary: The American Civil Liberties Union is running an ad alleging that the USA Patriot Act allows authorities to search homes “without notifying us . . . treating us all like suspects.” That’s not exactly true.

title: Misinforming Voters From The Stump
summary: Bush and Kerry both pepper their standard political speeches with misleading claims.

title: Kerry & Bush Duel Over Medicare Premiums – Who’s To Blame For The 17% Increase?
summary: Bush falsely claims Kerry voted repeatedly to raise premiums. Kerry’s spot blaming Bush alone for the latest increase isn’t much better.

title: A False Ad About Assault Weapons
summary: A new MoveOn PAC ad implies machine guns are becoming legal, which isn’t true. And it blames Bush, even though Bush said he would have extended the ban on assault weapons.

title: Kerry Exaggerates Cost of War in Iraq
summary: Kerry is using an exaggerated figure for the cost of the Iraq war in his latest line of attack against Bush, claiming in the latest version of his standard stump speech that the war in Iraq has cost “$200 billion and counting.”

title: Democratic Group’s Ad Revives “AWOL” Allegation Against Bush
summary: “Texans for Truth” group features another Alabama Guardsman who doesn’t recall seeing Bush in 1972.

title: Zell Miller’s Attack on Kerry: A Little Out Of Date
summary: Miller slams Kerry for opposing bombers, fighters, and helicopters. That WAS true 20 years ago but not lately.

title: Update on Kerry’s “Shrinking Middle Class” — Still Shrinking in 2003
summary: In an earlier article, we said Kerry based his claim that “our great middle class is shrinking” on some pretty stale numbers. Now fresh numbers are available — and Kerry’s statement is looking a lot better.

title: Bush Still Fudging the Numbers on Kerry’s Tax Votes
summary: The Bush-Cheney campaign released a television ad August 23 accusing Kerry of casting “98 votes for tax increases.” The number is an improvement on Bush’s  earlier claim that Kerry cast 350 votes for “higher taxes,” which we described as inflated. But even the new, reduced total is padded.

title: DNC Radio Ad on Terrorism: Accurate (Mostly)
summary: Democratic ad reminds voters: Bush opposed creating the Homeland Security department before he supported it.

title: Yucca Mountain Mudslide: Both Sides Dissemble on Nuclear Waste Dump in Nevada
summary: MoveOn.org Voter Fund falsely attacks Bush, who comes back with a misleading ad about Kerry.

title: Swift Boat Veterans Anti-Kerry Ad: “He  Betrayed Us” With 1971 Anti-War Testimony
summary: Group quotes Kerry’s descriptions of atrocities by US forces. In fact, atrocities did happen.

title: Radio Ads Accuse Kerry Of Not Helping Blacks
summary:
Summary
The newly established group People of Color United (PCU) began running a series of radio ads August 2 that challenges John Kerry’s record on “helping and hiring Blacks.”
Some of the content is misleading. One ad blames Kerry for ensuring that jobless workers won’t be eligible for an extra 13 weeks of unemployment benefits. It’s true Kerry missed a crucial vote in which an extension of benefits fell just one vote short of Senate passage,

title: Bush Nails Kerry’s Poor Attendance at Intelligence Committee Hearings
summary:
Summary
A Bush-Cheney ’04 ad released Aug. 13 accuses Kerry of being absent for 76% of the Senate Intelligence Committee’s public hearings during the time he served there. The Kerry campaign calls the ad “misleading,” so we checked, and Bush is right.
Official records show Kerry not present for at least 76% of public hearings held during his eight years on the panel, and possibly 78% (the record of one hearing is ambiguous).
Kerry points out that most meetings of the Intelligence Committee are closed and attendance records of those meetings aren’t public,

title: DNC Ad Says Bush Lost Manufacturing Jobs
summary: The Democratic National Committee released an ad Aug. 6 saying 2.7 million manufacturing jobs had been lost under Bush. That’s true, but ignores the fact that manufacturing jobs started their decline three years before Bush took office.

title: Media Fund Ad Misquotes Bush
summary: An ad released by the Media Fund is targeted to Ohio, featuring Ohio residents criticizing the President for loss of jobs overseas. In it, one of them says, “When President Bush says he’s going to help companies outsource jobs, it’s infuriating.” Bush didn’t say that.

title: Republican-funded Group Attacks Kerry’s War Record
summary: Ad features vets who claim Kerry “lied” to get Vietnam medals. But other witnesses disagree — and so do Navy records.

title: Internet “Whispering Campaigns” Falsely Accuse Teresa Heinz Kerry
summary: Bogus e-mail messages claim she’s given millions to “radical” groups, some linked to terrorists, and located Heinz factories overseas. Both claims are false.

title: Kerry’s Dubious Economics
summary: He says new jobs are paying $9,000 less than the old ones. That’s not a fact.

title: Anti-Kerry Ad Highlights Changes On Welfare, Death Penalty
summary: A Club for Growth PAC TV ad released July 26 accurately cites Kerry’s changing positions over the years on welfare reform, the death penalty for terrorists, and gasoline taxes. But it also falsely implies that he’s voted to raise taxes 350 times, a claim we’ve de-bunked before.

title: Kerry Blames Corporate Tax Code for Shipping Jobs Overseas
summary: But economists say ‘outsourcing’ jobs overseas is a minor problem that Kerry’s plan wouldn’t do much to fix.

title: Bush’s “16 Words” on Iraq & Uranium: He May Have Been Wrong But He Wasn’t Lying
summary:
Summary
The famous “16 words” in President Bush’s Jan. 28, 2003 State of the Union address turn out to have a basis in fact after all, according to two recently released investigations in the US and Britain.
Bush said then, “The British Government has learned that Saddam Hussein recently sought significant quantities of uranium from Africa.” Some of his critics called that a lie, but the new evidence shows Bush had reason to say what he did.

title: Bush Ad Faults Kerry’s “Family Priorities”
summary: It highlights stark differences between the two on teenage abortions and morning-after birth control pills in schools.

title: MoveOn PAC Internet Ad: Creative Editing
summary: Reality is one thing, and what political ads make of it is another. This ad pitting Cheney’s words against Edwards’ is a case in point.

title: Radio Ad Attacks Nader Over GOP Support
summary: Group run by Democrats says “right-wing Republicans” and “extremists” aid Nader to help Bush. Characterizations aside, they’ve got a point.

title: Bush Ad Claims Kerry Voted Against “Protections for Pregnant Women”
summary: It’s a misleading ad. What Kerry really voted against was the “Unborn Victims of Violence Act.”

title: Economy Producing Mostly Bad Jobs? Not so fast.
summary: A new set of figures from the Bureau of Labor Statistics show HIGHER-paying jobs growing faster. A FactCheck.org exclusive. (But there’s evidence on both sides).

title: Small Kerry Boast Brings Big Bush Attack
summary: Kerry’s “strategy to win the war on terror” is puffery; Bush’s response is much ado about ten words.

title: New Bush Ad Features McCain Endorsement
summary: It’s a fact McCain endorsed Bush. It’s also a fact he criticized Bush’s war performance.

title: Anti-Kerry Ad Misses Context, Distorts Facts
summary: An ad by the pro-Bush Progress for America Voter Fund (PFA) attacks Kerry for voting against intelligence spending and for voting against “13 weapons systems our troops depend on.” The ad is partly accurate, but misleads by starving the facts of context.

title: Kerry “Paperwork” Ad: Accurate
summary: Kerry ad says medical paperwork costs hundreds of billions and his plan could save money. He’s right. But what about the expense?

title: Bush Contradicted On Iraq & al Qaeda? Or not?
summary: Even the 9-11 commissioners don’t agree about whether their staff report contradicted the Bush administration.

title: Anti-Bush Ad Overstates Case Against Halliburton
summary: MoveOn PAC ad says administration gave contracts “on a silver platter,” but government investigators say otherwise.

title: Draft Fears Fueled by Inaccurate E-mails
summary: A scare story spreads electronically, but it gets facts wrong.

title: Bush Ad Claims His Tax Cuts Exceed Reagan’s
summary: New ad says his cuts are “the largest tax relief in history.”  Some experts disagree.

title: Kerry Health Care Ad: Exaggerated, But Mostly on Target
summary: He says 43 million don’t have “health care.” He means they don’t have insurance.

title: Kerry Stays Positive, Avoids Specifics
summary: His latest ad is all generalities, no facts.

title: Bush Ad Falsely Implies Kerry Would Repeal Wiretaps of Terrorists
summary: In reality, Kerry favors some of the same “safeguards” as several conservative Republicans.

title: Bush Ad “Doublespeak” Leaves Out Some Context
summary: It quotes negative comments from newspapers, but doesn’t mention that they are editorial expressions of opinion.

title: Environmental Group’s Ad Distorts Bush’s Record on Florida Drilling
summary: It says he “opened up Florida’s coast” to offshore oil and gas wells. That’s off base — by 100 miles.

title: Twisted Facts and Falsehoods in Media Fund Ad
summary: Democratic group’s ad claims Bush turned White House into “corporate headquarters,” but backs that up with false claims.

title: Bush Education Ad: Going Positive, Selectively
summary: Bush ad claims “dramatic results” in Texas schools, but fails to mention data-manipulation scandal.

title: Kerry’s Positive Ads: Selective Facts, Subtle Digs & Some Puffery
summary: Over the top: Kerry’s boast that his vote “created 20 million new jobs.”

title: More Bush Distortions of Kerry Defense Record
summary: Latest barrage of ads repeats misleading claims that Kerry “repeatedly opposed” mainstream weapons.

title: Kerry Ad on Abortion: Fuzzy Math
summary: Kerry claims the Supreme Court is “just one vote away” from overturning abortion rights for women. Make that TWO votes.

title: Treasury Tax Expert to Bush: Clinton’s Increase WASN’T The Biggest.
summary: Study published by Bush’s Treasury Department contradicts Bush’s campaign.

title: Kerry’s “Misery Index” Accentuates the Negative
summary: Kerry invents a new “Misery Index.” The old one makes Bush’s tenure look better than most.

title: Bush Ad Is “Troubling” Indeed
summary: The President’s ad recycles bogus claims, then tells only part of the story about Kerry’s position on tax breaks for couples and children.

title: Outsourcing Jobs: The PRESIDENT Said That?
summary: Kerry ad puts words in Bush’s mouth that Bush never uttered.

title: Bush’s Gas Attack: Does Good Policy Make Bad Politics?
summary: Kerry once voiced support for a 50-cent increase in the gasoline tax. Bush calls that “wacky,” but Bush’s chief economist praised the idea.

title: Taxing Social Security & Gasoline: Bush Attack Lacks Context
summary: Kerry supported an increased tax on Social Security benefits, but he also supported a repeal and Bush didn’t.

title: Democratic Internet Ad Confuses Fiction and Fact
summary: Animated cartoon claims Bush cuts education funding, but it’s really up 58%.

title: Bush Accuses Kerry of 350 Votes for “Higher Taxes.” Higher Than What?
summary: Bush campaign falsely accuses Kerry of voting 350 times for tax increases. Bush’s own words mislead reporters.

title: Did Kerry Vote “No” on Body Armor for Troops?
summary: Yes, along with $87 billion worth of other things. But Bush didn’t send enough in the first place.

title: Bush Strains Facts Re: Kerry’s Plan To Cut Intelligence Funding in ’90’s
summary: President claims 1995 Kerry plan would “gut” the intelligence services. It was a 1% cut, and key Republicans approved something similar.

title: Bush Says Kerry Will Raise Taxes $900 Billion; Kerry Says That’s False
summary: Attack ad revives question of whether Kerry’s numbers add up.

title: Conservative Group Engages in Class Warfare Vs. Kerry
summary: Citizens United TV ad calls Kerry a “rich, liberal elitist.” But Bush is rich, too. So was George Washington.

title: Would Bush Eliminate Overtime Pay for 8 Million?
summary: A TV ad from an anti-Bush group says so. But it’s based on a study that actually says something different.

title: Bush’s Re-Election Campaign Begins on a Positive Note
summary: His first three TV ads are downright bland, with lots of generalities and few facts for us to check.

title: Kerry’s Attack Video Misleads on Veterans, Jobs
summary: Campaign says Internet ad is to ‘set the record straight.’ But it contains some distortions.

title: Biggest Deficit in History? Yes and No
summary: Kerry said Feb. 26 that Bush’s budget deficit is “the largest in history.” But by the most important measure that’s not quite true. Half a trillion dollars is the most ever, but several others have been worse relative to the size of the economy.

title: Did Kerry Oppose Tanks & Planes? Not Lately
summary: Kerry voted often against nuclear missiles and bombers in the ’90s, but GOP claims that he opposed a long list of conventional weapons are overblown.

title: Here We Go Again: Bush Exaggerates Tax Cuts
summary: The President can’t keep his figures straight. And most people are getting less than he implies.

title: Funding for Veterans Up 27%, But Democrats Call It A Cut
summary: Money for veterans goes up faster under Bush than under Clinton, yet Kerry accuses Bush of an unpatriotic breach of faith.

title: Bush’s Misleading Attack Video
summary: Internet attack ad says Kerry got most “special interest money” of any senator. He didn’t. And Bush got lots more.

title: New Evidence Supports Bush Military Service (Mostly)
summary: Newly released records reflect payments and credits for Air National Guard service meeting minimum requirements, despite a six-month gap.

title: Defending Spending? Bush’s Blooper
summary: The President wrongly claimed he cut the growth of discretionary spending. Reality: the growth rate multiplied.

title: Oops! Clark Falsely Accuses Kerry & Edwards on Taxes
summary: The General says he can’t understand why they voted for Bush tax cuts. Well, they didn’t.

title: Gephardt Ad Quotes Dean Out of Context
summary: Tough attack twists Dean’s words about Medicare.
